page.title: 02Agriculture 1
page.content: Very little of our land is used for building purposes it is mainly agricultural.The main land use in our area is arable.There is fertile soil especially in the Great Hollanden Farm area,this is because about 10,000 yrs. ago after the Ice Age,water flowed from the hills around and carried and deposited fertile silt.In other parts of Hildenborough there is Hildenborough clay.There is also fertile soil in the east of our area around Shipbourne. Wheat,barley and oats are grown,oats near Horns Lodge,wheat and barley grow extensively where there is good soil.Other crops grown in smaller quantities are peas,beans and rape.The peas go to Japan to be dried and salted like peanuts,if the beans are fresh they are used as cattle food,if mouldy they are used as dog biscuits.
